title: Case-Based Problem-Solving Learning for Anemia: Integrated PBL-TBL Project

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in a blended learning environment using digital devices (tablets/laptops), consisting of weekly 3-hour intensive sessions. Learners experience converting real clinical scenarios into mathematical models

learning_goals: A problem-solving model linking six core concepts (blood components, iron metabolism, statistical analysis, etc.) through case analysis of anemia patients can be proposed.
Structured reports (including graphs/tables) documenting mathematical reasoning processes can be created through team-based discussions.
The validity of problem-solving strategies can be accurately judged with over 80% precision using peer feedback rubrics.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
